perturbation.original_text: Nothing in this Agreement shall cause Subcontractor in any way to be construed as a partner or joint venture with, or an employee of, EDGE in connection with or arising from Subcontractor's rendering of Work to EDGE pursuant to this Agreement. EDGE retains Subcontractor only for the purposes and to the extent as set forth in this Agreement, and Subcontractor's relation to EDGE during the term of this Agreement shall be that of an independent contractor and nothing herein shall create or imply any other or different relationship. Subcontractor acknowledges that: (a) nothing herein constitutes the exercise by EDGE of control or direction over the manner or method by which Subcontractor will perform the Work, (b) Subcontractor is solely responsible for the withholding and payment of all federal, state and local income, social security and unemployment taxes, salaries, and other payments required to be made by it from funds received from EDGE hereunder, and (c) that EDGE is not required to and will not provide any worker's compensation or other insurance coverage of any nature, or any other unemployment, medical, dental, welfare or pension benefits to Subcontractor or any of its employees, associates or subcontractors.
perturbation.changed_text: Nothing in this Agreement shall cause Subcontractor in any way to be construed as a partner or joint venture with, or an employee of, EDGE in connection with or arising from Subcontractor's rendering of Work to EDGE pursuant to this Agreement. EDGE retains Subcontractor only for the purposes and to the extent as set forth in this Agreement, and Subcontractor's relation to EDGE during the term of this Agreement shall be that of a contractor and nothing herein shall create or imply any other or different relationship. Subcontractor acknowledges that: (a) EDGE may, at times, provide direction over the method by which Subcontractor will perform the Work, (b) EDGE may assist with the withholding and payment of all federal, state and local income, social security and unemployment taxes, salaries, and other payments required to be made by it from funds received from EDGE hereunder, and (c) that EDGE is required to and will provide worker's compensation or other insurance coverage of any nature, or any other unemployment, medical, dental, welfare or pension benefits to Subcontractor or any of its employees, associates or subcontractors.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'independent contractor' to 'contractor' and modifying the subsequent clauses, the agreement now introduces ambiguity regarding the true nature of the working relationship. The added provisions contradict the typical characteristics of an independent contractor under Texas and federal law, such as control over work methods and responsibility for taxes and benefits. This creates uncertainty regarding whether the subcontractor is truly an independent contractor or should be classified as an employee, which would have significant legal implications.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Texas Labor Code, Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA)

perturbation.original_text: A. Subcontractor shall be permitted to subcontract any part of the Work without the prior written notification and consent of EDGE. However, Subcontractor will follow subcontracting requirements and processes of EDGE and provide joint access to subcontractor database and information concerning quality control. All Work performed by a Lower-tier Subcontractor shall be deemed Work performed by Subcontractor. Subcontractor agrees not to hire any Lower-tier Subcontractor to whose employment EDGE reasonably objects.
perturbation.changed_text: A. Subcontractor shall be permitted to subcontract any part of the Work with the prior written notification of EDGE. However, Subcontractor will not be required to follow subcontracting requirements and processes of EDGE and not provide joint access to subcontractor database and information concerning quality control. All Work performed by a Lower-tier Subcontractor shall not be deemed Work performed by Subcontractor. Subcontractor agrees to hire any Lower-tier Subcontractor to whose employment EDGE reasonably objects.
perturbation.explanation: These revisions introduce contradictions that undermine the clear responsibility and control initially assigned to the Subcontractor regarding the Lower-tier Subcontractors. By removing the consent requirement, negating the need to follow EDGE's subcontracting processes, stating the opposite with work done by Lower-tier Subcontractors and hiring if EDGE reasonably objects, creates uncertainty as to liability. This misalignment significantly deviates from standard construction subcontracting practices where the primary contractor is responsible for the actions of its subcontractors and must adhere to quality control and approval protocols.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding delegation of duties and liability for subcontractors' actions.

perturbation.original_text: B. EDGE may accept any nonconforming Work instead of requiring its removal and correction upon the condition that Subcontractor shall pay EDGE an appropriate amount for damages and compensation as is mutually agreed upon by EDGE and Subcontractor. Warranty is not waived under such conditions.
perturbation.changed_text: B. EDGE may accept any nonconforming Work instead of requiring its removal and correction upon the condition that Subcontractor shall pay EDGE an appropriate amount for damages and compensation as is determined at EDGE discretion. Warranty is waived under such conditions.
perturbation.explanation: This change alters the condition under which EDGE can accept nonconforming work. By removing the 'mutually agreed upon' requirement for damages and compensation and giving EDGE sole discretion, the clause becomes potentially unfair and unenforceable. Furthermore, stating 'Warranty is waived under such conditions' directly contradicts the previous statement that warranty is not waived. This conflict undermines the intended warranty protections and introduces ambiguity regarding the subcontractor's obligations for defective work. It deviates from typical warranty agreements where both parties must agree on compensation for non-conforming work.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of contract law regarding warranty, fair dealing, and good faith.
